translated: Itivuttaka🔽The Collection of Threes
The Third Section
More peaceful

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:

original: “Rūpehi, bhikkhave, arūpā santatarā, arūpehi nirodho santataro”ti.
analyzed: rūpehi bhikkhave arūpā santatarā arūpehi nirodhaḥ santataro ti
translated: “Formless states are more peaceful than forms, and cessation is more peaceful than formless states.”
The Blessed One said this.
And in this connection it was said:
“Those beings who have gone to forms
and those who abide in formless states,
not knowing cessation,
return to renewed existence.
But those who fully understand forms
and are not stuck on formless states,
who are liberated in cessation,
they are the people who have overcome death.
Having touched with their body🔽the deathless state free of clinging,
having realized the relinquishment of all clinging,
they are free of defilements.
The Fully Enlightened One teaches
the sorrowless, dust-free state.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This too was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.
The fourth.
